intro: Rauvolfia tchibangensis, commonly known as the African snakeroot, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It is a climbing shrub that produces small, yellowish flowers and dark purple berries. The plant belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its woody stems and opposite leaves. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in rainforests. The plant has been traditionally used in folk medicine for its potential health benefits.
